original: Jacobson, John Oscar, civilingenjör, fd. belysningschef, Kalmar, f. 16/4/79 i Kulltorp, Jönköp. 1., av dir. Claes Adrian J. o. Sofia Torbjörnsson. — Stud:ex. 99, civ:ing:ex. 02. Förest, f. Kristianstads kem. station 03-05, f. Uddevalla gasverk 05-07 o. f. belysn:-verken i Kalmar 07-46. Byggt gasverk i UddevaUa 05 o. i Kalmar 07, elverk i Kalmar 08. Ui^pf. bl. a. laddn :maskin f. retortugnar o. metod f. koksstybbs f öirb r ä nnà ng i rmel e diii mg sp an n o r. Hobby: musik. RVO.
translated: Jacobson, John Oscar, engineer, former lighting manager, from Kalmar, born on April 16th, 1879 in Kulltorp, Jönköping. Son of director Claes Adrian J. and Sofia Torbjörnsson. He completed his high school education in 1899 and earned his engineering degree in 1902. He served as head of the Kristianstad chemical station from 1903-1905, the Uddevalla gas works from 1905-1907, and the Kalmar lighting works from 1907-1946. He built gas works in Uddevalla in 1905 and in Kalmar in 1907, and an electric power plant in Kalmar in 1908. He developed several techniques such as loading machines for retort furnaces and methods for coke stubs to be thrown into melting pans. His hobby was music, and he was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa. He married, but the name of his partner and the exact year of the marriage are not provided.

structured.name: John Oscar Jacobson
structured.description: John Oscar Jacobson was a Swedish engineer and former lighting manager who was born on 16 April 1879 in Kulltorp, Jönköping, Sweden.
